content: colorful fairy doors the fairy village of cypress knee is famous for its bright colored doors little folk travel far and wide to take photos near their favorite ones their handcrafted wooden frames and tiny brass door knobs add to their whimsy these thumb-sized fairy doors are a super quick knit they are knit in the round on dpns from the bottom up because they have a front and a back they don t require blocking their wooden frames and brass door knobs are done using embroidery the bottom is sealed shut using either embroidery or your cast on end they are fairy approved copyright 2024 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 finished measurements height 2 / 5cm width 1 5 / 4cm or desired size approximate yardage 8 yards/7 3 meters or less of worsted yarn minimal brown and yellow for embroidery yarn i used patons classic worsted because i like a nice firm fabric needles one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm or size to obtain gauge gauge optional 6 stitches and 6 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette video links how to do chain stitch how to do a french knot fairy door instructions using your door color cast on 16 sts leave a long tail for sewing the bottom closed if you do not want to use chain stitch along the bottom edge divide the stitches over 3 dpns and join to work in the round round 1-12 knit remove a needle redistribute the stitches so that needle 1 & 2 now both have 8 sts each round 13 ssk k4 k2tog repeat 12 sts round 14 ssk k2 k2tog repeat 8 sts round 15 ssk k2tog repeat 4 sts break yarn and draw through remaining 4 stitches draw tight and hide end inside of door finishing the door frame is stitched onto the front side with a chain stitch the bottom is left open at the beginning so the embroidery is easier to do cut a piece of 40 /102cm frame colored yarn and insert it onto a tapestry needle starting at the right or left corner of the bottom travel to the opposite corner making a chain stitch along the edges you now have 2 options for sealing the bottom of your door shut option 1 chain stitch the 2 sides together first making sure all ends are trimmed and stuffed inside option 2 use your cast on end to stitch the bottom shut again making sure all ends are trimmed and stuffed inside your door for the door knob make a french knot hide ends inside of door 2 cypress knee s colorful fairy doors abbreviations k = knit k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to your right needle then return the now- turned stitches back to the left needle knit them both together through
